00061 class LinearModel : public Model
00062 {
00063 public:
00064         LinearModel(int dimension)
00065         {
00066                 inputDimension = dimension;
00067                 outputDimension = 1;
00068 
00069                 parameter.resize(dimension);
00070                 parameter = 0.0;
00071         }
00072 
00073         ~LinearModel()
00074         {
00075         }

00078         void model(const Array<double>& input, Array<double> &output)
00079         {
00080                 if (input.ndim() == 1)
00081                 {
00082                         int i;
00083                         double value;
00084                         output.resize(1, false);
00085                         value = 0.0;
00086                         for (i=0; i<inputDimension; i++) value += input(i) * parameter(i);
00087                         output(0) = value;
00088                 }
00089                 else if (input.ndim() == 2)
00090                 {
00091                         int j, jc = input.dim(0);
00092                         int i;
00093                         double value;
00094                         output.resize(jc, false);
00095                         for (j=0; j<jc; j++)
00096                         {
00097                                 value = 0.0;
00098                                 for (i=0; i<inputDimension; i++) value += input(j, i) * parameter(i);
00099                                 output(j) = value;
00100                         }
00101                 }
00102                 else throw("[LinearModel::model] invalid number of dimensions.");
00103         }
00104 
00105         void modelDerivative(const Array<double>& input, Array<double>& derivative)
00106         {
00107                 if (input.ndim() == 1)
00108                 {
00109                         derivative = parameter;
00110                 }
00111                 else if (input.ndim() == 2)
00112                 {
00113                         int j, jc = input.dim(0);
00114                         derivative.resize(jc, getParameterDimension());
00115                         for (j=0; j<jc; j++) derivative[j] = parameter;
00116                 }
00117                 else throw("[LinearModel::modelDerivative] invalid number of dimensions.");
00118         }
00119 };
